title: With Mideast Deal, Trump Is on the Brink of a Major Diplomatic Accomplishment
summary: For President Trump, success in brokering a cease-fire is the ultimate test of his self-described goal as a deal maker and a peacemaker.

summary: Plus, Dolly Parton wants you to know she “ain’t dead yet.”

title: Trump Fires Black Officials From an Overwhelmingly White Administration
summary: Separately, in the administration’s first 200 days, only two of 98 Senate-confirmed appointees to the most senior jobs in government were Black.

summary: University leaders are wary of a new proposal from the Trump administration to impose far-reaching changes in higher education.

summary: The basic political conflict in America has changed to something very different than the one putting health care to the fore.

summary: The Illinois governor, a potential presidential candidate, is fighting the presence of National Guard troops and the activities of ICE agents in Chicago.

summary: Judge Karin Immergut blocked President Trump from sending National Guardsmen to defend against a “rebellion.” Now three judges will hear the government’s appeal.

summary: As local anxiety builds, Illinois officials say the deployment of Guard troops violates state sovereignty, while the White House says the troops’ presence is needed.

summary: ​The prize committee said the Hungarian writer’s work “reaffirms the power of art.”

summary: The awards are being announced this week.

title: At the Met’s ‘Divine Egypt,’ the Gods are Eternally Fabulous
summary: A once-in-a-decade exhibition of ancient deities — many are goddesses — ranging over more than 3,000 years, from monumental statues to gleaming figurines.

summary: Republicans in the Senate blocked a measure that would terminate the president’s legally disputed campaign targeting alleged drug runners.

summary: The Trump administration has said that it is attacking boats and killing their occupants because they are smuggling drugs from Venezuela to the United States.

summary: John Williams, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, is primarily concerned with weakness in the labor market.

summary: The rapid proliferation of drones in places like Ukraine has set off a growing sense of alarm inside the U.S. Army.

title: What the Arrival of A.I. Video Generators Like Sora Means for Us
summary: Welcome to the era of fakery. The widespread use of instant video generators like Sora will bring an end to visuals as proof.

summary: Jack Ciattarelli, the Republican nominee, and Representative Mikie Sherrill, the Democrat, described starkly different visions for the state in a debate Wednesday.

summary: Every year, hot rods take over a beach in New Jersey for an event that is equal parts sporting event, fashion show and “time capsule.”

summary: The president is going after clean energy, and Americans will face higher bills as a result.

title: A Gaza Deal

summary: “You would be better off dressed as kielbasa in Chicago,” Jimmy Kimmel advised the National Guard troops President Trump wants to deploy to the city.

title: In Germany’s Depressed East, Tanks Are the Lesser of Two Evils
summary: Even leaders from the far-right Alternative for Germany party, which opposes aid to Ukraine, have embraced the jobs that come with new weapons production.

summary: Jose Uribe pleaded guilty to bribing New Jersey’s former senator, Robert Menendez, and his wife, Nadine Menendez. He went on to testify at their trials.

title: A Stolen Dinosaur Named Claire Is Returned to a California Gas Station

title: China Clamps Down Even Harder on Rare Earth Exports
summary: The move is Beijing’s latest attempt to tighten control over global production of the metals, which are essential to the manufacture of computer chips.
